titleStmt.title: W. S. Watsan et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8707

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excelency the Govener of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, the undersigned would respectfully represent that some time in the year 1860, one John Todd was arrested and triedExamined before the presiding Judge of the Ballard county court for Larceny, and inlarged by the said presiding Judge of the court afd upon Bail in the sum of Two Hundred and fifty Dollars, and the following gentlemen became sureties for the appearance of the said John Todd at the next Term of the Ballard Equity and criminal court to answer any indictment the Grand Jury might find against him, to wit Elijah Unsell, C. P. Ray and Jessee Hinkle. that the said John Todd fled the commonwealth to parts unknown. so that the said sureties have been wholy unable to surrender him so as to ans answer the indictment found by the Grand Jury, and whereas owing to the unsettled state of the country it would be an exceeding Hardship to inforce the Judgement of the Ballard Equity and criminal court against the said sureties, who would have omitted no reasonable efforts had times been such as to have favored their efforts them for the surrender of the said fugitive to the authorities therefore the undersigned would Respectfully ask your Excelency to remit the forfeiture, and protect the said Ray Unsell and Hinkle from the enforcement of the Judgement afd and as in duty bound your petitioners will ever pray &C

W S Watsan
P Montle
James Howle
Willim C Ray
O, F, Nichols
J T Parker
E Evans
T. P. Linthecum
William Harris
D, M, Coil
R. B Griffin

Thos H. Corbett

Ballard Eq & Crim Ct
$200 } For. Recog --

No grounds shown for the interference of the Executive. Surety always requires his
JFR.

When a further statement of facts in this case made by the Representative one half of the fine in this case is remitted
18 Feby 1863
J F Robinson
